pullRequest.title: [BEAM-11355] Fix topological ordering of pipeline_from_stages after sort_stages
pullRequest.bodyText:
Under some conditions, translations.pipeline_from_stages() after translations.sort_stages() could return a pipeline that was not topologically sorted due the construction of the tree of parents to subtransforms. This change ensures that the pipeline is topologically ordered by ensuring that when a transform is added to the pipeline, each of its ancestors become the last subtransform of its parent.

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -557,8 +557,13 @@ def add_parent(child, parent):
             pipeline_proto.components.transforms[parent])
         copy_output_pcollections(components.transforms[parent])
         del components.transforms[parent].subtransforms[:]
-        add_parent(parent, parents.get(parent))
+      # Ensure that child is the lsat item in the parent's subtransforms.

nodes.bodyText: Isn't sort_stages called before this? Or did you mean this is required to maintain the topolicial order from sort_stages?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -557,8 +557,13 @@ def add_parent(child, parent):
             pipeline_proto.components.transforms[parent])
         copy_output_pcollections(components.transforms[parent])
         del components.transforms[parent].subtransforms[:]
-        add_parent(parent, parents.get(parent))
+      # Ensure that child is the lsat item in the parent's subtransforms.
+      # This is required to maintain topological order with sort_stages.
